Description: Fragment of tondo of Attic red-figured pottery kylix. Youth, head to left, body frontal, actively handling an uncertain object; cord around his shoulders suggests he is wearing a petasos.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The iconography suggests this is Theseus lifting one of his opponents, a common theme at this period.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 237, no. 229)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1521)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4785 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
